text: this dish is made for entertaining it's
made for a party because roasting two
chickens is just as easy as roasting one
but it feeds a heck of a lot more people
and the great thing is as the chickens
cook the drippings go all over the plums
and the whole thing melts down into this
rich a little bit sweet chutney that you
serve on top of the chicken first thing
you want to do is you want to make your
spice rub I add some lemon zest some
grated garlic and then I have spices I
have sumac lots of black pepper I have
some cinnamon I have some allspice and
then of course salt susumi is a very
mild flavor it has a little bit of a
tartness it has a complex flavor it has
an earthiness it also makes the skin
absolutely beautiful you just want to
add enough olive oil until it becomes
kind of like a paste should look like
almost like wet sand and now I just want
to rub it all over the chicken people
sometimes forget to season the inside
the cavity but it helps season the whole
bird so we've got to do it you let the
chickens marinate in the fridge and the
key thing here is you want them to
marinate uncovered because this gives
the skin a chance to dry out and it'll
get even more crisp before you roast off
the chickens you want to take them out
of the fridge and let them come to room
temperature that helps them cook more
evenly this is a very autumnal dish to
me you make this when plums are sort of
at the end of their season they're
getting a little bit soft but they still
have amazing flavor and they're perfect
to cook
halfway through roasting the chickens
instead of basting them what I like to
do is just squeeze a little bit of fresh
lemon it drizzle them with a little bit
of olive oil and it flavors them and it
also flavors the plums on the bottom
this is basically like a one pan meal
because everything cooks at the same
time so after I pop it into the oven the
dinner party can begin
Oh
